intro: Brachypodium miserum var. miserrimum, commonly known as the weedy brome, is a grass species native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial plant characterized by its slender,丛生 stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and wastelands. Due to its adaptability, it is considered an invasive species in some regions.
